Overview.Summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin is expected to announce his run for a fifth term in office in the 2024 presidential election (1, 4, 7, 9, 10). The election is scheduled for March 17, 2024 (1, 4, 5, 9). This comes after US President Joe Biden announced he will not be running for re-election and endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris as the Democratic Party's new nominee (2, 3). The election is expected to be another easy win for Putin, who has already served as president for longer than any other Russian ruler since Josef Stalin (4). However, there is some controversy surrounding the election as all elections are currently prohibited under the country's martial law (6). Putin has also signed amendments to the presidential election law that limit media coverage of the election (8).

Timeline.Text: The Russian presidential election is scheduled for March 17, 2024.
President Vladimir Putin signs amendments to the presidential election law, which restrict media coverage of the upcoming election.
A fierce row erupts over the upcoming 2024 election in Ukraine, as all elections are currently prohibited under martial law.
The date for the presidential election is officially set for March 17, 2024, with President Putin expected to run for a fifth term.
President Vladimir Putin announces his intention to run for re-election in the 2024 presidential election at the behest of soldiers.
President Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race.
Vice President Kamala Harris is endorsed by President Biden as the Democratic Party's new presidential nominee.

Overview.Summary: In the 2024 Russian presidential election, incumbent President Vladimir Putin submitted documents to register as a candidate (4) and is widely expected to win another term (9). The election is scheduled for March 17, 2024 (5,9). However, a Communist candidate, Nikolai Kharitonov, also received approval to run (2). The first presidential election in Russia's modern history was held on June 12, 1991 (8). In contrast, the United States presidential election of 1968 saw several potential challengers, including George Romney, Nelson Rockefeller, and George Wallace (10). President Joe Biden announced that he will end his presidential re-election campaign (3). Panama also held a presidential election in 2024, with Jose Raul Mulino declared the unofficial winner (7). A pro-peace Russian politician also submitted documents to register as a candidate (6). Crime and safety were among the biggest concerns for voters in the Dominican Republic's presidential election (1).

Timeline.Text: Communist candidate Nikolai Kharitonov is approved to run in the Russian presidential election.
Vladimir Putin submits documents to register as a candidate for the 2024 Russian presidential election.
José Raúl Mulino is declared the unofficial winner of Panama's presidential election.
Dominican Republic President Luis Abinader declares himself the winner of the weekend's presidential election.
President Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 United States presidential race.
The date for the 2024 Russian presidential election is set for March 17.
Vladimir Putin presents documents to Russia's Central Election Commission to register as a candidate for the 2024 presidential election.
Pro-peace Russian presidential hopeful presents documents to register as a candidate for the 2024 election.
The deadline for submitting documents to run in the 2024 Russian presidential election.
The United States presidential election of 1968 takes place.

Overview.Summary: In March 2024, the Russian Senate voted to hold the next presidential election, with incumbent President Vladimir Putin expected to announce his candidacy and win another term (2). Putin announced his decision to run for president again in 2024 (3, 5, 7). The election will also include a candidate from the Communist Party of Russia (4, 9). Some speculate that the 2024 election will be a close race, with only 10,000 people potentially deciding the outcome (6). Changes to Russia's presidential election laws have also been signed by Putin (10).

Russia sets the date for the 2024 presidential election for March.
Putin confirms he will run for president again in the 2024 election.

A Communist candidate is approved to run in the presidential election.
A photo of the Russian presidential election in progress is shared on Wikimedia Commons.
The voting process for the Russian presidential election begins.
Volodymyr Zelensky's presidential term expires.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Russian presidential election is scheduled for March 17, 2024 (1,2,3,6,7,8,9,10). Incumbent President Vladimir Putin is expected to announce his candidacy and win another term (1,10). Putin has been in power for a quarter-century (3) and has recently tightened media rules for election coverage (5). There is speculation that he will rule until 2030 (5). George Clooney has endorsed Kamala Harris for the 2024 election (4), while U.S. intelligence is looking into possible Russian influence on the election (4). Some key Democrats have urged President Biden to step down ahead of the election (4).

Timeline.Text: The Russian parliament may announce the date of the 2024 presidential election as March 17.
Putin tightens media rules ahead of the 2024 presidential election.
The Russian Senate officially sets the date of the 2024 presidential election as March 17.
Vladimir Putin is inaugurated for his fifth term as president, solidifying his quarter-century grip on power in Russia.
George Clooney endorses Kamala Harris for the 2024 presidential election, while U.S. intelligence looks into possible Russian influence on the election.
Russian lawmakers approve the date of the 2024 presidential election, paving the way for Putin's fifth term in office.
Sources say that Vladimir Putin will run in the March 2024 presidential election.

Overview.Summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin is expected to run for a fifth term in the 2024 presidential election (1,2,7,8,9,11,13,15,18,20). The election is set to take place on March 17, 2024 (1,2,7,8,9,11,13,15,18,20). This would extend his quarter-century grip on power in Russia (12). However, there have been some concerns about the fairness of the election due to restrictions on media coverage (13,16). Some political figures, such as former US President Joe Biden and actor George Clooney, have expressed their opinions on the upcoming election (5,6,14). The election is also taking place against the backdrop of the ongoing Ukraine war (10,20).

Timeline.Text: Russian lawmakers set the date for the 2024 presidential election for March 17.
A fierce row erupts over the 2024 Ukrainian presidential election, with all elections being prohibited due to martial law.
Russian lawmakers prepare to announce the preliminary date of the 2024 presidential election on December 13.
Russia officially sets March 17 as the date for the 2024 presidential election.
Vladimir Putin announces his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election at the request of soldiers.
Vladimir Putin is formally nominated as an independent candidate for the 2024 presidential election.
Vladimir Putin is inaugurated for his fifth term as president.
Volodymyr Zelensky's presidential term expires.
President Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race.
George Clooney endorses Kamala Harris for the 2024 Democratic presidential nominee.
Vladimir Putin wins the 2024 presidential election and extends his rule as Russian president.
